website_summaries.verdict: The Jaybird Run are comfortable, workout-friendly true wireless earphones with clear sound quality that could use just a little more bass response.
pros: Crisp, clean sound with good high-mids and highs

customer_reviews.title: Easy set and don’t fall out !
customer_reviews.text: I have tried both the Bose Soundsport Free and the Jabra Sport Elite, both had to be returned due to them falling out of my ears whilst running. The Bose especially as I couldn’t run more than 20 yards without them falling out and feeling throughout like rhey were going to. The Jaybird Run on the other hand feel secure throughout, sound is great, setup is seamless. Thank goodness I saw a YouTube review comparing all three.... so pleased I got these.
customer_reviews.author: ProfSteve

customer_reviews.title: great sound. I have tried many
customer_reviews.text: great sound. I have tried many, but these are definitely the best, using their Android App and calibrating the sound you want! genius. The only thing (and it's a huge thing) that I hate is the lack of button functionalities!! With the Jabra 65t, I can skip tracks, answer calls, change volume etc.. directly on the buds. With these, I can only program them to EITHER skip track or change volume....
customer_reviews.author: ReviewsTrend

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit my ears
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research I bought these as the fit was said to be good. However, I have not been able to find a tip & wing combination that works consistently. Sometimes they fit well, sometimes only one fits well and sometimes they do not stay in with the smallest head movement. I guess this is an issue with many in-ear buds, but the Runs are very expensive so I would have expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Jo_N

customer_reviews.title: Support says to reset the headphones but this just isn't a good enough solution as it has to be done every ...
customer_reviews.text: Constantly go quiet. Support says to reset the headphones but this just isn't a good enough solution as it has to be done every time you use them
customer_reviews.author: Sean R.

customer_reviews.title: poor ears
customer_reviews.text: Excited to get them but they feel a bit clunky in my ears and get uncomfortable after an hour of wearing. My main reason for the rating is inconsistent connection between right and left earbud which keeps dropping out. It's so random. When I'm moving or sitting still, I can have an hour of solid, uninterrupted listening or it's on and off all the time. Very frustrating and will return them. I called Jaybird. They were super nice but reading the reviews it seems they haven't sorted this problem out which is a shame. I might consider a different make and cheaper buds. They say you get what you pay for but not true in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. L. Spink

customer_reviews.title: Great sound with intuitive app and sleek look
customer_reviews.text: Love there! You need to ensure that you use the app. Or sometimes both headphones will not connect! The sound quality was surprisingly decent. I thought it was gonna be muddy but it wasnt. The app also let's you fully customised the EQ and has a lot useful presets. The fit well and look great in the ear All and all a great and worthwhile purchase for £75! Makes the commute to and from work less cumbersome because there are no wires.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: I've had these for a good few weeks now and have used them in the gym every day, I loved the fact that I had no wires.
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones but had to send back as started to disconnect from phone and when getting sweaty switching off so 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Jaybird X3 instead
customer_reviews.text: Had to send these back. Sound volume is really poor. Whilst the wired (between bud) Bluetooth versions are excellent these unfortunately do not live up to the same standard. Now rocking a pair of Jaybird X3, my X2’s lasted over a year with daily sweat abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Black

customer_reviews.title: Let down by poor Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of these things are amazing, my only problem is the Bluetooth connectivity which can be temperamental at times. Which is a shame because they are a great product I use for about 7 hours a day while at work. Putting them back in their case and taking them out usually fixes the connection issues as this resets the Bluetooth connection. Still a great product but could definitely be better, I look forward to the next revision of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Did they test these before releasing them?
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but poorly executed. The right bud connects to your bluetooth device it then relays the signal to the left bud, this is where the problem lies. The connection from right to left continually drops. Other reviewers have noted the same issue. I cannot believe they released this product with this serious and fundamental flaw. Just terrible, will return these.
customer_reviews.author: Naz

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at a deeply discounted price of £40. For this price it is a steal. Yes, connection sometimes drops in one ear for no reason but for the price I paid, i am very happy but would be very annoyed if i paid the full price. The fit is very secure and never had any slips during runs up to 10k
customer_reviews.author: O. Sevik

customer_reviews.title: Ok for gym and short runs
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for these considering the price, but disappointed. I used them for running whilst training for a marathon and as soon as you start sweating and moisture gets into your ear they’re hopeless. Also connectivity is a frequently dodgy and the battery life is poor. Great for the gym and short runs, and even day to day use, but not for distance running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, total frustration eventually
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds worked fine for the few couple of months but eventually stopped. Every time I turn on both of them after a few seconds they switch off.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sismanidis

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding comfy headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. Used for 35min run three times per week and have not seen any disconnection issues other users have complained about Sound great especially after customisations in the Jaybird app. I would not hesitate to recommend
customer_reviews.author: MR JAMES BOGGUST

customer_reviews.title: Good Device
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are quite good, I have not noticed any problems with them and they sound quite good once you tweak the equaliser from Jaybird's app. The earphones stay in my ear fairly well but I need to repush them every every so often to ensure that they don't fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Decent earbuds
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses these in the gym and she loves them. They are not too big, do not fall out even after a long workout (i.e. sweatty body), they are easy to set up and control.
customer_reviews.author: JayDrav

customer_reviews.title: Don't worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I really tried to like them but they are just not worth the money. I could not fit them well in my ears. A pair of £20 bluetooth earphones does the same job or better. Sound quality is fine but not amazing.
customer_reviews.author: user

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: really nice wireless headphones. comfortable. great sound and good quality case/charger
customer_reviews.author: CHRISSY

customer_reviews.title: good... for less than 3 months... cannot handle sweat..
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were supposedly the best headphones for working out... and they were OK for sound / fit during first three months (despite constantly needing to be re-set because of Bluetooth issues). Nonetheless, they've stopped working altogether now.. seems to be from sweat ruining the interior
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: There was static at low volume and the connection would cut out frequently something i did not expect when i spent this type of money. Thinking of just going back to wired.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth Earphones -
customer_reviews.text: Jaybird sport earbud, are first class Bluetooth headphones that sound great when working and fitted perfectly in my ears
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Freedoms still best of line. But - don’t believe the naysayers. These are an excellent compromise for totally wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money compare to other headset in the same price range. I have managed to charge my headsets with the charge station 3 times before having to plug into a power source.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great idea - poor design
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but no matter what rubber adapters are used, they feel like they’ll fall out. To make them firmly for it gives you ear pain
customer_reviews.author: healthmate

customer_reviews.title: Not the best!
customer_reviews.text: Awfull! Firstly, it gets really uncomfortable after wearing it for an hour. Secondly it doesn't fit inside my ear properly. Thirdly it's really unresponsive, the volume has delays.
customer_reviews.author: Tirth

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Smart bit of kit don’t fall out when running nice and snug
customer_reviews.author: kevin  pugh

customer_reviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
customer_reviews.text: Really poor. Left ear bud will constantly lose connection. The lag is unbelievable so watching any video is impossible. There is absolutely o redeeming feature to these.
customer_reviews.author: Preez

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t really fault them, great sound, I use them for the gym and long walks!
customer_reviews.author: Zanelli

customer_reviews.title: Birthday present for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: She was very pleased with them, hope they are good!
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Awsome product
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband for his birthday an he loves them They sync well to his phone and stay in his ears - a great purchase
customer_reviews.author: B Horton

customer_reviews.title: Great for music while working out
customer_reviews.text: I use these at the gym and they are perfect for the job
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good sound, good
customer_reviews.text: Fit well but could be fiddly at first , good sound , good product
customer_reviews.author: Derrick R Dent

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sports headphones
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, good sound quality, and they don’t fall out when in train!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Easy to pair up, comfy and gud for low level exercise
customer_reviews.author: JandJ

customer_reviews.title: Poor fitting
customer_reviews.text: Poor fitting left earbud. Lost within 2 weeks of purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jones

customer_reviews.title: Poor, Really Poor
customer_reviews.text: Out of Sync, when people are talking, there's a noticeable delay, mine also makes a hissing sound. Not too sure if that is normal but im definitely returning these.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser3000

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality Not Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after several reviews stated that these had the best fit and audio quality out of the competition and unfortunately I was left disappointed. These in-ear phones provide a great fit and the app (I used on the OnePlus 5T) was excellent for sound customization but the drivers really don't produce near enough clarity for a product in this price range even after adjustment.Other products, even as low as £15 (admittedly, not FULLY wireless) sound substantially better.I would stick with wireless products (such as Apple Airpods or Anker SoundBuds Slim) or with the wire link for now while waiting for this new technology to get better.
customer_reviews.author: Andy C

customer_reviews.title: Utter Crap!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely garbage!! Barely stay connected unless your isolated in a field with no-one around! In the city glitch in and out constantly
customer_reviews.author: Ian Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Lag when watching YouTube
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and sound quality but the lag when watching YouTube is unbearable. Hard resetting and using the latest updates doesn’t work. Watching videos from the camera works fine so must be an app compatibility problem.
customer_reviews.author: James Keenan

product_meta.title: JaybirdRUN Wireless Headphones for Running, Bluetooth 4.1, Omni-Directional Mic, 4+8 Hours of Battery, Sweat-Resistant, Comfort-Fitted Earpieces, Skip-Free Music, Drift, White
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Run Drift

Whether you’re searching for running headphones or a professional wireless speaker set that is water - and sweat proof, you’ll find the Jaybird RUN to your satisfaction. The Jaybird RUN wireless headphones are light as a bird, yet tough as iron. Designed to fit any ear shape and for virtually any athletic application, these wireless headphones are designed to handle sweat, rain and even mud. The Jaybird RUN are true wireless earbuds that provide users with a secure and comfortable fit, regardless of the shape of their ear. Interchangeable tips and fins that are included in the package permit a custom fit. Just put them in and forget you’re wearing them. RUN’s interchangeable tips and fins give you a highly comfortable fit that stays in place while you push for a new personal best.

The downloadable Jaybird app allows users to customize the sound for a distinct music experience. This app permits you to adjust low, mid and high levels to create a sound that fits your style. These wireless headphones for athletes feature a dual-battery system with fast charging on the go. The headphone battery will run strong for 4 hours, plus an additional 8 hours with the portable charging case. They can also be used for mobile phones. The Jaybird RUN gives users true wireless earbuds with a mic and a single control button, so you can power your run without breaking focus. They are also very quick to charge. A 5 minute fast charge gives you 1 hour of play time, which means you never have to train without motivation.

Performance upgrades are also possible by downloading updated firmware. Get firmware updates that ensure your true wireless headphones are always performing at their top level. The latest firmware to improve Bluetooth connectivity is available on the Jaybird website.



BOX CONTAINS
Wireless sports headphone (left and right earbud); 2 sizes silicone round ear tips; 2 sizes silicone oval ear tips; 4 sizes ear fins; Charge case; USB 2.0 charging cable; Carry pouch; Quick-start guide; 2-year manufacturer’s guarantee
feature_bullets: Ideal Athletic Wireless Headphones: The Jaybird RUN are true wireless earbuds that give you a secure, comfortable fit, regardless of the shape of your ear; interchangeable tips and fins permit a ideal fit. Compatible products: any bluetooth device with HFP, HSP and A2DP

Sweatproof and Waterproof: Runners, athletes and others will feel comfortable using the Jaybird RUN wireless headphones; sweat all you want, push yourself in the rain and get muddy, as these wireless headphones are sweat- and waterproof
Customised Sound Setting: The downloadable Jaybird app allows users to customise the sound for a distinct music experience; adjust low, mid and high levels to create a sound that fits your style

12 Hours Battery Life: These wireless headphones for athletes feature a dual-battery system with fast charging on the go; the headphone battery will run strong for 4 hours, plus an additional eight hours with the portable charging case
Music and Call Capacity: The Jaybird RUN gives users true wireless earbuds with a mic and a single control button, so you can power your run without breaking focus
Impedance is 16 Ohm. Speaker sensitivity is 103 plus by minus 2 Decibel at 1 KiloHertz

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
